bug.author: komodovaran
bug.summary: Streamlit can't mix numpy int64 and int
bug.description:
Streamlit version 0.55 Using something like the builtin max() or min() on a Numpy arrays will return int64 rather than int, which causes Streamlit to complain: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import numpy as np
n = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
l = st.number_input( min_value = min(n), max_value = max(n), value = 3, label = "Length", ) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>streamlit.errors.StreamlitAPIException: All arguments must be of the same type. `value` has int type. `min_value` has int64 type. `max_value` has int64 type. </denchmark-code>
Ideally Streamlit should treat them the same, so the end user doesn't have to wrap everything with int() or the likes.

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/komodovaran>@komodovaran</denchmark-link> -- I agree this is suboptimal! I'll fix this week. Thanks!
